data.question: What is the proton conductivity value of PCMOF10 at 70 °C and 95% RH?
Is PCMOF10 water stable?
What is the role of the 2,5-dicarboxy-1,4-benzenediphosphonic acid (H6L) linker in PCMOF10?
data.answer: It anchors a robust backbone and has hydrogen phosphonate groups that interact with the lattice water to form an efficient proton transfer pathway.

data.question: Does the structure of PCMOF10 swell upon hydration?
What is the activation energy for proton transfer in PCMOF10?
How was PCMOF10 synthesized?
data.answer: Solvothermally in a Teflon-lined autoclave by adding Mg(NO3)2·6H2O and H6L to a mixture of methanol and H2O and heating to 150 °C.

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of PCMOF10 dependent on humidity?
What happens to the proton conductivity of PCMOF10 at 70% RH compared to 95% RH?
data.answer: It drops significantly from 3.55 × 10–2 S cm–1 to 4.17 × 10–4 S cm–1.

data.question: What confirms the water stability of PCMOF10?
data.answer: The PXRD patterns of the as-synthesized and water-soaked samples were in good agreement.

data.question: Does PCMOF10 retain its structure and properties after immersion in water?
What is the crystal system of PCMOF10?
What is the formula of PCMOF10?
What is the shortest hydrogen bond distance observed in PCMOF10?
data.answer: Between the lattice water molecule (Ow) and one of the coordinated water molecules (O10).

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of PCMOF10 reproducible after consecutive heating and cooling cycles?
What is the significance of the extensive O–H···O hydrogen-bond network in PCMOF10?
data.answer: It forms an efficient proton transfer pathway in the MOF pores.

data.question: Does PCMOF10 exhibit high proton conductivity under anhydrous conditions?
What is the thermal stability of PCMOF10?
data.answer: It shows a weight loss of 19.03% below 210 °C, attributable to the loss of lattice and coordinated water molecules.

data.question: Are the organic hydrogen atoms in PCMOF10 located in geometrically ideal positions?
What is the role of magnesium atoms in the structure of PCMOF10?
data.answer: Each magnesium atom is octahedrally coordinated to two water molecules, a carboxylate oxygen, and three phosphonate oxygens.

data.question: What confirms the reproducibility of proton conductivity in PCMOF10?
data.answer: The pre- and postimpedance PXRD patterns.
